name: Menyanthes
Relationship: Antidote: CAMPH.Compare: CAPS.; PULS.; CALC.; PHOS-AC.; SANG.

Head: Weight pressing on brain with every step on ascending
Pain from nape over whole brain; better, stooping, sitting; worse, going upstairs
Pressing in vertex; BETTER, HARD PRESSURE WITH HAND
Pressing-together pain
Cracking in jaw and twitching of facial muscles
Fever: Coldness predominates; felt most acutely in abdomen and legs and tip of nose
Stomach: Sensation of coldness extending up to oesophagus
Ravenous hunger; passing away after eating a little
Abdomen: Distended and full; increased by smoking tobacco
Extremities: ICY COLDNESS OF HANDS AND FEET
As soon as patient lies down, LEGS JERK AND TWITCH

details: A remedy for certain headaches, intermittent fever. Coldness of abdomen. Twitchings. Sensation of tension and compression. Fidgets and urinary difficulties in women. Diabetes.
